alert.note: Alert for Carver; Dakota; Hennepin; Scott (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 25 at 8:36PM CDT until May 27 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Savage affecting Hennepin, Scott, Carver and Dakota Counties. .Dry conditions continue which will allow river levels to continue falling. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River at Savage. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 702.0 feet, Barge loading affected at Port Cargill, and other flood prevention measures are begun. Water begins to impact Black Dog Road in Burnsville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 PM CDT Thursday, the stage was 702.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 800 PM CDT Thursday was 703.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 697.2 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 702.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 702.8 feet on 10/01/1986. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
